plugins.name: BrowserLens
plugins.description:
This plugin lets you import color styles from the BrowserLens web extension. Insert colors as layers in your design and add palettes to your local styles.


Learn more about BrowserLens: https://browserlens.com/

Documentation: https://docs.browserlens.com/


How to Use

  1. Open any webpage with the BrowserLens extension.
  2. Click export > Figma (BrowserLens Plugin).
  3. Download the style file for Figma.
  4. Run this plugin and upload the style file.
  5. Choose whether to add colors as local styles.
  6. Click 'Import Styles'.


About BrowserLens


BrowserLens is a web extension designed to extract styling and seo information from any webpage without the need for developer tools. It provides a simple UI for extracting and copying webpage information from the current tab.


Extension Features

  1. ‚å®Ô∏è View fonts used on a webpage and the associated CSS values.
  2. üñåÔ∏è Extract colors from a webpage and click to copy color value.
  3. üåÖ Extract gradients from a webpage and click to copy CSS value.
  4. üé® Export color palettes to Figma.
  5. üåê Preview SEO data including page meta, OpenGraph tags and Twitter Card data.
  6. ‚úÖ Check SEO meta for best practices including title and description length.
  7. üñºÔ∏è List all images present on a page and click to download, including background images.
  8. üåÉ Dark mode support.

plugins.name: QR Code Automation
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to update / replace all QR codes in your Figma file with just one click! You have the total control over sizes, and Color!


How to use it:


  1. Create a text layer.
  2. Name the text layer "QR-Link". (You can change the content of this layer at any time ‚Äî the name should remain "QR-Link".)
  3. Create one or multiple rectangles (squares) and name them "QR-Code".
  4. Create a second text layer
  5. Name the text layer "QR-color", and add the Hex code of the color you want your QR-Code to have inside the text layer.
  6. Run the Plugin


The plugin will generate a QR code using the content from the "QR-Link" text layer. It will place the QR code over each rectangle named "QR-Code" and match the dimensions of the rectangle. If the rectangle is inside a frame, the QR code will be placed inside that frame as well.


If you run the plugin again, the existing QR codes will be replaced with the updated ones.


Hint:

  1. It's not a problem if there are multiple text layers named "QR-Link" ‚Äî just make sure that all of them contain the exact same text content. Otherwise, the plugin will not run.
  2. It does not matter if you add the Hex-code with or without the #
plugins.tagline: Auto update multiple QR-Codes with one click

plugins.name: Zeytal Variables Extractor
plugins.description:
Zeytal helps developers extract and optimize SVGs, transform Figma styles and variables, and generate TailwindCSS config files effortlessly.


This plugin helps Zeytal users leverage their Figma variables.


Zeytal Features

  1. Extract and optimize SVGs
  2. Extract and convert Figma variables to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  3. Extract and convert Figma styles to .ts, .js, .json, .css, .scss, .sass, and .less files
  4. Convert Figma styles and variables to TailwindCSS v4 config files.


This Plugin

This plugin helps Figma users prepare their Figma files for Figma variables extraction and code generation.


How it works :

  1. Start the plugin.
  2. Click on one button to export your Figma variables to Zeytal
  3. Use Zeytal CLI to generate your code and config files


Everything is explained in detail in Zeytal documentation.

plugins.name: push-my-icons
plugins.description:
Push your Figma SVG icons to GitHub with ease.


This plugin helps you

  1. Automatically extract SVG nodes
  2. Upload them to your GitHub repository
  3. Generate a pull request with added/updated/removed icons


How to Use

  1. Open the plugin and fill in the following fields:
  2. GitHub personal access token
  3. GitHub repository URL
  4. Target folder path in the repo (e.g., src/icons)
  5. Pull request title and description
  6. Select all frames that contain your SVG icon components.
  7. Each selected frame should be a top-level container for one or more SVGs.
  8. Click "Push" button.
  9. The plugin will:
  10. Export all SVGs found in the selected frames
  11. Upload them to the specified folder in your GitHub repo
  12. Create a pull request containing added, updated, or deleted icon files
plugins.tagline: Push selected Figma icons to GitHub in one click.

plugins.name: AI Brand Guide
plugins.description:
AI Brand Guide transforms your design files into comprehensive, professional brand guides in seconds. Extract and organize design elements from your Figma files to create beautiful, developer-friendly documentation.


Key Features

  1. Intelligent Design Element Categorization: Automatically organizes your elements into Buttons, Icons, and Other Elements based on naming patterns
  2. Multi-Frame Export: Choose between Single Frame (all sections in one scrollable frame) or Separate Frames (each section in its own dedicated frame)
  3. Color Palette Extraction: Automatically extracts colors from your selection with detailed RGB, HEX, and HSL values
  4. AI-Powered Color Naming: Generate professional, creative names for your color palette with a single click
  5. Color Theory Generation: Create comprehensive color theory documentation including palette overview, color roles, visual qualities, and usage recommendations
  6. Typography Hierarchy System: Extracts and organizes typography into a structured system with Header and Paragraph classifications
  7. Component Documentation: Displays detailed specifications for buttons, icons and other elements including exact dimensions and padding values
  8. Visual Previews: Generates thumbnail previews for all design elements
  9. Form Element Detection: Special handling for contact forms and other form elements with improved display


How It Works

  1. Select your design elements in Figma (frames, components, or entire pages)
  2. Generate your brand guide with a single click
  3. Customize your guide: Rename colors, add color theory, or organize elements
  4. Export to Figma: Choose your preferred layout style and generate a complete brand guide directly in your Figma file


Element Categorization

For best results, use these naming patterns:

  1. Buttons: Include "btn" or "button" in the name (e.g., "btn-primary", "submit-button")
  2. Icons: Include "icn" or "icon" in the name (e.g., "icn-home", "arrow-icon")
  3. Other Elements: Include "element" or "other" in the name (e.g., "card-element", "other-banner")


What's Included in Your Brand Guide

  1. Color Palette: Complete color documentation with visual swatches and color codes
  2. Typography System: Organized type hierarchy with font details and visual examples
  3. Buttons Collection: All button variants with exact dimensions and padding specifications
  4. Icon Library: Organized icon set with dimensions and specifications
  5. Additional Elements: Cards, banners, forms and other UI components with detailed measurements
  6. Color Theory: Optional section providing insights on palette psychology, symbolism and usage


AI Brand Guide helps design teams maintain consistency while giving developers the exact specifications they need to implement designs accurately.
plugins.tagline: Transform designs into comprehensive brand guides with AI-powered color intelligence.

plugins.name: LARA for Figma
plugins.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/
plugins.tagline: Bring the power of LARA to your process

136539.name: LARA for Figma
136539.description:
LARA is the flagship product of Lithero, the first AI company to design and build products specifically for pharma marketing teams. LARA is a custom-made AI that learns the nuances of pharma brands at lightspeed, supporting brand teams throughout the end-to-end content creation process.


The official LARA for Figma plugin brings the power of LARA Screen and LARA Claims to your workspace. Get actionable feedback on the compliance of your content at the point of creation, saving significant time downstream. LARA for Figma complements the content creation process by ensuring high quality and accuracy of created content. Shorten review cycles, reduce spend, and get the most out of Figma with LARA!


Key Features:

Claims

- Detect differences between created content and approved claims, enabling corrections before MLR

- Trace claims back to their references and associated safety text in LARA Claims for additional context


Safety Text

- Identify and insert any required safety text missing from the content

- Generate accurate & complete safety text blocks to insert into content


References

- Find potential approved references that could be used to substantiate claims

- Locate any claims that are missing citations to typically seen references


*Requires subscription to LARA Claims and Screen. For more information, visit https://www.lithero.com/

plugins.name: WCAG Ëâ≤ÂΩ©ÂØπÊØîÊ£ÄÊü• WCAG Color Checker
plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin helps you evaluate the contrast ratio between text and background colors in your design frames, ensuring they meet WCAG accessibility standards. Perfect for designers aiming to improve readability and accessibility.


Function Introduction

‚Ä¢Check text-background contrast ratio within selected frames.

‚Ä¢Evaluate contrast according to WCAG standards (AAA, AA, A, Fail).

‚Ä¢Visualize contrast results and interact with your design directly.

‚Ä¢Automatic identification and highlighting of areas needing improvement.


Usage

1.Select a frame in your Figma file.

2.Run the plugin and click ‚ÄúCheck Contrast.‚Äù

3.Review the results, which are sorted by contrast ratio.

4.Click on any result to highlight and improve specific text elements.


Notes

‚Ä¢Ensure text layers are properly named for better result identification.

‚Ä¢The plugin currently supports checking text against solid color backgrounds only.

‚Ä¢For best results, use the plugin on well-structured design frames.

plugins.name: SDS App Tokens Export
plugins.description:
The plugin exports colour variables as tokens for iOs and Android using a predefined format.


The plugin assumes that there are Core and Semantic collections of variables, and also checks if a variable refers to a variable from another library.


For example, the core collection contains variables like Blue/0, Pink/100, which are given a hex colour.


Semantic collection contains aliased variables of the form Brand/Primary: Pink/100. If a variable does not contain an alias reference, it is converted as a core token.


Using

The plugin gives you a choice of collection, Mode and colour scheme, which is contained in the first level of naming in Semantic collections.


Outputs

  1. for Core iOS: public static let Blue0 = Color(hex: "FFFFFFFFFFFFF")
  2. for Core Android: val Blue0: Color = Color(colour: 0xFFFFFFFFFF)
  3. for Semantic iOS: BrandTextPrimary: Color.DSColorPalette.Pink900
  4. for Semantic Android: BrandTextPrimary = DSCorePalette.Pink900
plugins.tagline: Export variables for mobile

plugins.name: Component State Mapper
plugins.description:
Tired of getting lost in complex component variants? Struggling to track every possible state, prevent design inconsistencies, and explain component logic to your team?


Introducing State Mapper, the essential Figma plugin that transforms your complex component sets into clear, interactive, and easy-to-understand visual maps. Stop navigating your variants blindfolded and gain a bird's-eye view of your entire component architecture.


With a single click, State Mapper instantly generates a live flowchart of all your variants, showing you exactly how they connect and what properties change between them.


Key Features:


  2. üó∫Ô∏è Instant Visual Mapping: Automatically generate beautiful, easy-to-read diagrams from any component set. See the full picture, from simple buttons to complex data tables.
  3. üî¨ Powerful Filtering & Layouts: Is your map too complex? No problem. Isolate exactly what you need by filtering properties and values. Switch between Hierarchical, Graph, and Matrix layouts to find the perfect view.
  4. ‚ö†Ô∏è Smart "Missing State" Detection: Our most powerful feature! State Mapper intelligently analyzes your component's properties and automatically flags potential "holes" or missing variants in your system, helping you prevent bugs before they happen.
  5. ü§ù Seamless Handoff & Documentation: Export your component maps as SVG or PNG to include them directly in your documentation on Confluence, Notion, or Jira. Make sure developers understand the logic perfectly.
  6. üîÑ Live Sync: Keep your map updated in real-time. As you add, remove, or change variants, your map reflects those changes instantly.

Who is it for?


State Mapper is built for meticulous Product Designers, UI/UX Designers, and Design System teams who want to build more robust, error-free, and well-documented components.


Install State Mapper today and bring order, clarity, and intelligence to your design system!
plugins.tagline: Bring clarity to component chaos.

1.Run the plugin from the Figma plugins menu

2.Adjust opacity and blur in the popup panel

3.Click ‚ÄúApply‚Äù to generate a liquid glass frame

4.The generated element appears centered in your viewport

‚Ä¢Performance may vary with complex canvases

plugins.description:
Transform your design process with instant, expert-level UX feedback.


UX Buddy is your personal design critic that never sleeps. This powerful Figma plugin analyzes your frames and provides instant, actionable feedback based on proven UX principles and industry best practices.


### What UX Buddy Does:

plugins.name: Dialekt
plugins.description:
Stop manually copy-pasting text for different languages! Dialekt helps you visualize localized designs early in your UX process. Simply select a mobile frame containing your text layers, and this plugin will:

  1. Find all text content within the selected frame.
  2. Automatically create five new frames, perfectly aligned.
  3. Translate the text in each new frame into Arabic, Spanish, Dutch, Portuguese, and French.

Ideal for designers working on multi-language apps who need to quickly see how text will look and fit in different languages during the wireframing or mockup stage.


Key Features:

  1. Translates text into 5 pre-set languages: Arabic, Spanish, Dutch, Portuguese, French.
  2. Automatically duplicates the selected frame for each language.
  3. Preserves original layout and styling (text length may vary).
  4. Simple few clicks operation.
plugins.tagline: Translate your designs into multiple languages

plugins.name: Layer Query
plugins.description:
A powerful layer selection plugin that lets you find and select layers based on their design properties and custom component properties. Perfect for managing large design files and design systems efficiently.


## Key Features


- Multi-property search with combination filters

- Custom component property support (boolean, text, variant, instance swap)

- Flexible search scope: Entire file, Current page, Root frame, or Selected frames

- Search results with page grouping and navigation

- Real-time search progress with cancellation support

- Cross-page layer selection and navigation


## Supported Properties


**Typography:** Font size, font family, line height, text alignment, text content

**Fill:** Fill color, opacity

**Size:** Width, height

**Padding:** All directions (top, bottom, left, right, vertical, horizontal)

**Auto Layout:** Direction, sizing, alignment, item spacing

**Stroke:** Stroke color, stroke width

**Corner Radius:** All corners and individual corner values

**Layer:** Layer name, structure, type, opacity

**Position:** X and Y coordinates

**Custom:** Component instance properties


## Perfect For


- Design system maintenance and auditing

- Finding layers with specific styling across large files

- Quality assurance and design consistency checks

- Efficient layer organization and cleanup

- Component property management


Save hours of manual searching with precise property-based queries. Transform your Figma workflow from manual hunting to smart selection.


## Beta Version


This plugin is currently in beta. Please report any issues or feedback to help improve the experience.
plugins.tagline: Query and select layers by properties including custom components. Advanced search for efficiency.
